task.title: Using the httpd.conf File
task.shortdesc: This task describes how to enable the Fast Response Cache Accelerator (FRCA) by modifying the HTTP Server's configuration file.

taskbody.context: By enabling FRCA in the httpd.conf file, you allow the HTTP Server to cache static content, improving response times for users. This task involves locating the configuration file, making the necessary changes, and restarting the server to apply the new settings.

step.cmd: Open the HTTP Serverâ€™s httpd.conf configuration file.
Locate or add the following directive:EnableFRCA On
Configure additional FRCA-related directives, such as FRCANoCaching, according to your caching requirements.
Save the changes to the httpd.conf file.
Restart the HTTP Server to apply the new configuration.
